intro: Hedlundia pauca, commonly known as the sparse hedlund, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its small, pale yellow to white flowers bloom during the cooler months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Hedlundia pauca is considered a species of conservation concern.
